definitions.definition: to release large amounts of liquid, gas, or other contents:
examples: The pipe was found to be disgorging dangerous chemicals into the sea.

definitions.definition: to send many people out of a place or vehicle at the same time:
examples: The delayed commuter train disgorged hundreds of angry passengers.

definitions.definition: to force something up from the stomach and out through the mouth:
examples: Flies disgorge digestive fluid onto their food to soften it up.

definitions.definition: to unwillingly release information or money:
examples: The judge has forced EXIP to disgorge $400,000 in illegal profits.
